align.description: Aligns flex container's lines within the flex container when there is extra space on the cross-axis
Sets the align-self value on all direct children as a group
Overrides a grid or flex item's align-items value
Sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns
Defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the main-axis of a flex container
Defines the default justify-self for all items of the box
Sets the way a box is justified inside its alignment container along the appropriate axis
Sets the order to lay out an item in a flex or grid container
Sets both the align-content and justify-content properties in a single declaration
Sets both the align-items and justify-items properties in a single declaration
Sets both the align-self and justify-self properties in a single declaration
Sets the size of the gap between an element's grid rows

animation.description: CSS feature for animating grid track sizes
Shorthand for animating an element along a defined path
Defines a ray function for use with the offset-path property
Defines the layout box to which the transform and transform-origin properties relate
Hints to browsers how an element is expected to change

at_rules.description: Detects whether the user agent has limited the color palette
Allows for more flexible media query ranges
Tests if the browser supports a particular CSS feature
Allows authors to opt particular elements out of forced colors mode

blend_modes.description: Defines whether an element must create a new stacking context

clipping_shapes_masking.description: Defines a circle as a basic shape
Creates a clipping region that sets what part of an element should be shown
Defines an ellipse as a basic shape
Specifies how the mask layer image is interpreted
Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract a shape from an image
Adds a margin to a shape-outside
Defines a shape around which adjacent inline content should wrap

contain.description: Indicates that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent of the rest of the document tree

counter.description: Sets a CSS counter to a given value
Specifies content that comes after the marker value
Specifies the symbols used by the marker
Allows defining a custom counter style inline
Defines the algorithm used to construct the counter's representation

flex.description: Shorthand property for flex-grow, flex-shrink, and flex-basis
Specifies the initial main size of a flex item
Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container
Shorthand property for flex-direction and flex-wrap
Specifies how much a flex item will grow relative to the rest of the flex items
Specifies how much a flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items
Specifies whether flex items are forced onto one line or can wrap onto multiple lines

functions.description: Clamps a value between an upper and lower bound
Inserts the value of a user agent-defined environment variable
Sets the size of a box to fit its content
Clamps a given size to an available size
Returns the largest of a list of values
Returns the smallest of a list of values
Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max
Represents a repeated fragment of the track list
Inserts the value of a custom property

Specifies a grid item's size and location within a grid
Specifies the size of implicitly-created grid columns

Specifies the size of implicitly-created grid rows

Specifies where a grid item begins
Specifies where a grid item ends
Specifies where a grid item begins

Defines the columns of the grid
Defines the rows of the grid

Blends two or more images at a defined transparency
Specifies a layout-independent rotation to be applied to an image
Specifies the intrinsic resolution of all raster images used in/on the element
Allows the author to provide multiple resolutions of an image

Defines the logical block start margin of an element

Defines the logical inline start margin of an element

Defines the maximum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode

Specifies how to handle content that overflows the inline axis of the element's box

Specifies the browser's behavior when the inline direction boundary of a scrolling area is reached

misc.description: Resets all properties (except unicode-bidi and direction)
Specifies the appearance of the text input cursor
Specifies the color of the text input cursor
Specifies the shape of the text input cursor
Specifies how a given region can be manipulated by a touchscreen user
Resets a property to its inherited value if it inherits, or to its initial value if not
Controls whether the user can select text
Reverts the cascaded value of the property from its current value to the value the property would have had if no changes had been made

print.description: Specifies the orientation of the page box
Specifies how user agents should optimize the presentation of the element when printed

pseudo_classes.description: Represents the element or ancestor of the element that is currently being displayed
Matches any element that has been defined, including built-in elements and custom elements
Matches elements based on the directionality of the text contained in them
Matches when an element receives focus and the user agent determines via heuristics that the focus should be made evident on the element
Matches an element if the element or any of its descendants are focused

Represents any element that is defined to occur entirely after a :current element

Matches the shadow host of a shadow DOM containing the CSS it is used inside
Represents a media element that is capable of playing when that element is paused
Represents a media element that is capable of playing when that element is playing
Represents an element with incorrect input, but only after the user has interacted with it
Represents an element with correct input, but only after the user has interacted with it

Matches WebVTT cues within a selected element
Matches WebVTT cue regions within a selected element
Represents any element within a shadow tree that has a matching part attribute
Matches any content that is inserted into a slot

relative_units.description: 1% of the size of the initial containing block in the direction of the root element's block axis
1% of the size of the initial containing block in the direction of the root element's inline axis

Specifies the character variant for the selected font

Defines a palette of colors for a color font
Specifies ornaments for the selected font

Specifies a swash alternate for the selected font

Enables an annotation on the selected font

Specifies a locally-installed font to use
Specifies the font family for a color font palette

Controls which missing typefaces can be synthesized by the browser

Specifies the anchor point of the element for the offset-path
Specifies the position along an offset-path
Specifies a motion path for an element to follow
Specifies the initial position of the element along the offset-path

Represents the elements that are within the scope of the @scope at-rule
Defines the starting styles for a transition
Tests if the browser supports a particular CSS selector
Overrides specific colors in a font palette
Defines the syntax of a custom property

Reverts a property value to the value established in a previous cascade layer

colors_theming.description: Specifies the accent color for user-interface controls
Specifies which color schemes the element can comfortably be rendered in

pseudo_classes.description: Matches elements that contain at least one element that matches the specified selector
Matches any of the selectors in the selector list
Matches elements based on their position among siblings, with optional filtering
Matches an element that is currently in picture-in-picture mode
Matches a popover element that is currently showing
Matches elements that match the selector list, but doesn't add specificity

Represents the marker box of a list item

Equal to the cap height of the element's font

Equal to the line height of the element

Overrides the font's descent metric

Controls the synthesis of superscript and subscript glyphs

view_transitions.description: Represents the root of a view transition pseudo-element tree

align.description: Specifies the alignment of tracks in a masonry grid
Specifies the alignment of tracks in a masonry grid along the inline axis

anchoring.description: Anchors an element to another element

aural_css.description: Specifies how a counter should be announced by speech synthesizers

color.description: Selects the color with the highest contrast from a list of colors

container_queries.description: Allows querying the computed values of an element's properties

functions.description: Defines an `<image>` value generated from an arbitrary HTML element
Defines an `<image>` in a similar fashion to the `url()` function, but with added functionality

grid.description: Specifies how items flow in a masonry layout

pseudo_classes.description: Matches elements that are in a modal state

pseudo_elements.description: Represents the text that has been scrolled to if the browser supports scroll-to-text fragments

scroll.description: A function that allows targeting specific text within an element

text_fragmentation.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be left at the bottom of a page
